column4: hi, is the notification thing supposed to queue notices? i only have one displayed at a time, even when i trigger more than one
The notification box on the top right of the desktop?
yeah
i only see one box ever, not more than one, like it's supposed to, right?
I'll show you what it does. May I private message you to send you like 5 messages real quick so you can see how it works (to avoid spamming this channel)?
you mean notify-send foo hello ?
and yes go for it
See? IT's one box but it keeps expanding.
no it doesn't
i just see one message
What message would that be?
whatever i send with notify-send
ie: notify-send boo; notify-send boo2;notify-send boo3
that just shows one box which slowly swaps between the messages
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1116278

Try this (this does it for me usually to get multiple bubbles) Change a song in your media player and adjust volume at same time. Or really anything with a notification and volume. Volume has its own notification bubble.
you're missing the point! i'm triggering the bubbles myself!
Yes, I udnerstand that and I gave you a link to the program you are using.
Previously I did not, that is correct, but the link I gave is about the program it would appear you are using?
so, is there a better notification program to use?
the notify plugin with ubuntu kinda doesn't work
it just feels like a cheap osx clone!
I do not know of any, I'm sorry. You could try Googling around though and see what you come acorss. I do not know of any though, no.
